input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/financial.sqlite" ".schema client" && sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/financial.sqlite" ".schema account" && sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/financial.sqlite" ".schema disp"
input.description: Get schema for client, account, and disp tables

content.content:
CREATE TABLE client
(
    client_id   INTEGER        not null
        primary key,
    gender      TEXT not null,
    birth_date  DATE       not null,
    district_id INTEGER        not null,
    foreign key (district_id) references district (district_id)
);
CREATE TABLE account
(
    account_id  INTEGER default 0 not null
        primary key,
    district_id INTEGER default 0 not null,
    frequency   TEXT   not null,
    date        DATE          not null,
    foreign key (district_id) references district (district_id)
);
CREATE TABLE disp
(
    disp_id    INTEGER        not null
        primary key,
    client_id  INTEGER        not null,
    account_id INTEGER        not null,
    type      TEXT not null,
    foreign key (account_id) references account (account_id),
    foreign key (client_id) references client (client_id)
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE client
(
    client_id   INTEGER        not null
        primary key,
    gender      TEXT not null,
    birth_date  DATE       not null,
    district_id INTEGER        not null,
    foreign key (district_id) references district (district_id)
);
CREATE TABLE account
(
    account_id  INTEGER default 0 not null
        primary key,
    district_id INTEGER default 0 not null,
    frequency   TEXT   not null,
    date        DATE          not null,
    foreign key (district_id) references district (district_id)
);
CREATE TABLE disp
(
    disp_id    INTEGER        not null
        primary key,
    client_id  INTEGER        not null,
    account_id INTEGER        not null,
    type      TEXT not null,
    foreign key (account_id) references account (account_id),
    foreign key (client_id) references client (client_id)
);

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/financial.sqlite" "SELECT c.client_id, c.birth_date FROM client c JOIN disp d ON c.client_id = d.client_id WHERE d.account_id = 130 AND d.type = 'OWNER';"
input.description: Find the owner of account 130 and their birth date

content.text:
The database contains a `birth_date` field for clients, but it only stores the **date** (1930-07-22), not a time of birth. The claim asserts a specific **time of birth** (03:17 AM), which is information that would come from a birth certificate — neither birth certificates nor times of birth are stored in this database.
